titleStmt.title: Exceeding good newes from Beverley, Yorke, Hull, and Newcastle. With the valliant acts of Sir John Hotham over the walls of Hull against the Kings forces, and how he hath taken ten captaines and cavalleres prisoners that were going to Barton in Lincolnshire. And how Sir John Hotham gave command to pull the mayors gowne of Hull off from his backe, and set a guard about his house. As also how Sir Iohn Hotham gave command to burne the houses that stood betwixt the Kings forces and Hull, least any of the Kings forces should shelter themselves, and so to assault the towne.
titleStmt.author: T. G.
Salwey, Humphrey, 1575?-1652.
Wilde, John, 1590-1669.

notesStmt.note: Two letters, the first signed T. G.; the second by John Wilde and Humphrey Salwey who were the committee deputed to visit Worcestershire.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
